title: Federated Search Support for On-prem to On-prem Environments
short-description: New enhancement enables search functionality across multiple on-prem Splunk deployments.

title: Bucket Merge Functionality for Standalone Instances
short-description: A new utility service is now available to help admins perform bucket merging to optimize stability and scalability. This feature is currently available for standalone instances.

title: Scheduler Observability and Performance Improvements
short-description: New enhancements to the search scheduler performance and telemetry.

title: Performance Improvements for Searchable Rolling Restarts
short-description: New improvements significantly speed-up searchable rolling restarts, in some cases by an order of magnitude.

title: Durable Scheduled Searches
short-description: Make scheduled searches durable to prevent event loss.

title: New JSON Commands
short-description: Additional functions for the eval command for working with JSON structured data.

title: Splunk Operator for Kubernetes
short-description: The Splunk Operator for Kubernetes (SOK) makes it easy for Splunk Administrators to deploy and operate Enterprise deployments in a Kubernetes infrastructure. Packaged as a container, it uses the operator pattern to manage Splunk-specific custom resources, following best practices to manage all the underlying Kubernetes objects for you.

title: Dashboard Studio
short-description: Dashboard Studio is a dashboard-building experience that offers advanced visualization tools and fully customizable layouts to easily create visually-compelling, interactive dashboards with an intuitive UI. Create new dashboards from the Dashboards listing page or save visualizations from Search.

title: Health Report Improvements and Search Head Cluster Health Report Capabilities
short-description: The Splunk health report now captures feature health status across nodes in distributed environments, including search head cluster members.

title: Search Restriction by Data Age
short-description: Splunk Search now provides a way to restrict end user search results by age of the event.

title: License Tracking Enhancements
short-description: New enhancement enables users to annotate personal notes to a specific license. This enables admins to easily track what a license was created for and how itâ€™s being allocated, without using a third-party interface.
